info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LANCASTER COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ephrata, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Ephrata, New Holland, Akron, Leola, Denver, Reamstown, Rothsville, Adamstown, Terre Hill, Churchtown, Leacock, Bareville, Bowmansville, Reinholds, Fivepointville, Schoeneck, Blue Ball, Farmersville, Goodville and Bird-In-Hand. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
